question: A 19-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of primary amenorrhea. She has well-developed breasts and pubic hairs but the uterus and vagina are absent. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A multigravida after 6th delivery is advised for the process of sterilization (birth control contraception). Which of the following structures is ligated in this female?
A 34-year-old lady developed a vaginal fistula as a result of prolonged labor. What is the most common location where vaginal fistula develops?

answers.option: Between vagina and urethra and bladder

question: A 24-year-old girl came to the out-patient-department with a history of prolonged menstrual cycle for months and increasing hair growth on chin and breast. Which of the following is not included in Rotterdam criteria?

answers.option: Increase LH/FSH ratio/Increase free androgen index

question: A 35-year-old woman came to gynaecology out-patient-department with a complaint of inability to conceive. She has been married for 5 years. Her husband is 38-years-old. Her husband had 2 kids from his first wife. Her body mass index is normal, serum FSH and LH and ultrasound pelvis are all unremarkable. She gives a history of dysmenorrhea and dyspareunia. What is the most important investigation for her?

A subfertile young couple visited the out-patient department with investigation of female partner serum progesterone day 21; 35 ng/mL, hysterosalpingography shows both tubes patent with normal uterine cavity. Her husband semen analysis shows pH 7.2, quantity 4 mL, sperm count 40 million/dL with motility normal forward movement of 5% and morphology 4%. What would be the most appropriate treatment option for this couple?

A 30-year-old nulliparous female married for 8 years attended gynaecology out-patient-department with complaints of heavy menstrual bleeding and generalized weakness for the last 6 months. She looks pale, pelvic examination shows a mass of about 20 weeks size, firm in consistency. Her Hb is 4.3. Ultrasound shows a solitary intramural fibroid of about 7*8 cm. She is very much concerned about her sub fertility because her marriage is at risk. What would be the immediate step in her treatment?

A 28-year-old nulliparous woman came in out-patient-department with a complaint of inability to conceive for 4 years. She has regular menstrual cycles. She has a history of appendectomy 2 years back. What could be the likely cause of her sub fertility from the following?

A 32-year-old woman, P2+0, last born six months back, presents to the gynaecology clinic with amenorrhea for three months. She has a history of irregular periods for six months and weight gain for five months. She is breastfeeding her baby and her body mass index is normal. Which of the following investigations will you advise her?

A lady presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of urinary incontinence after delivery. Urodynamic studies show leakage during increased intra-abdominal pressure and confirm the diagnosis of stress incontinence. What should be the first-line management?

A 19-year-old tall girl presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of primary amenorrhea. On examination, pubic and axillary hair is sparse, and genitalia are ambiguous. On ultrasound, the uterus is absent. Her karyotype is XY. What can be the cause of the primary amenorrhea?
What is the percentage of ectopic pregnancies with tubal implantation?
Which of the following is the reason for combining estrogen and progesterone in oral contraceptive pills?
Which of the following structures provides level 1 support to the pelvic organs?
What is the reason for prescribing estrogen therapy in postmenopausal women?

A 20-year-old unmarried nulliparous female presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy menstrual bleeding. On ultrasound, two intramural fibroids measuring 8x12 cm are seen. What is the appropriate treatment for this patient?

A female patient presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of vaginal bleeding for 3 months. On examination, there is increased glandular proliferation in the endometrium without an increase in stroma. It involves the whole thickness of the endometrium but has not spread to any other structure. Which of the following statements is true about this condition?

answers.option: It involves pathogenesis through PI3K/AKT pathway
It is a high grade mucinous carcinoma
It is a high grade serous carcinoma

question: Which of the following conditions is most commonly associated with endometriosis?
What is the likely diagnosis of an epithelial tumor containing cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast proliferation, but no chorionic villi?

A patient presented to the emergency room with severe abdominal pain, shoulder tip pain, and vaginal bleeding. She had amenorrhea for 2 months. On ultrasound, it showed a dilated and ragged fallopian tube. A provisional diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy was made. What would be the most appropriate management option for this patient?

answers.option: Emergency surgery for ruptured ectopic pregnancy

question: A 69-year-old female patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of post-menopausal bleeding. What is the gold standard investigation for endometrial biopsy?

A pregnant patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of first-trimester bleeding and vaginal passage of grape-like vesicles. On investigation, her beta HCG levels were highly elevated, whereas on ultrasound, it showed a snow-storm appearance. Which of the following statements is correct about this condition?

answers.option: Trophoblastic proliferation is focal and slight
It is also called triploid mole
Genetic material is from paternal side only

question: Which hormone is responsible for the formation of spermatozoa from spermatids by acting on Sertoli cells?
A couple married for 3 years is unable to consummate the marriage. The female experiences superficial dyspareunia and apprehension. She has regular menstrual cycles. What is the likely cause?
Which of the following is an indication to use progesterone without estrogen?
What is the sensitivity of pap smear screening for high-grade cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN)?

A 21-year-old girl presents with low mood, mastalgia, abdominal pain, and gut disturbance one week before menstruation. The symptoms occur every month and interfere with her social life and daily activities. Her menstrual cycle is regular. What is the likely cause of her presentation?

A 15-year-old girl presents with complaints of increasing abdominal pain, vaginal swelling, and pain during micturition. Her breast development is normal but she has not begun to menstruate. On observation of the genitalia, a tense blue swelling at the level of the hymen is seen. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 53-year-old woman presents with persistent pelvic pain and abdominal distension. Ultrasound scan shows a large pelvic mass of 12 cm x 15 cm in diameter which is attached to the omentum. The tumor has a heterogeneous appearance with solid and cystic components. What is the best management option for this patient?

answers.option: Total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

question: A 25-year-old woman is using injectable medroxyprogesterone acetate as a method of contraception. Which adverse effect is a concern if she wishes to use this therapy long-term?
A 36-year-old woman requests birth control. She has no medical conditions, and she smokes one pack of cigarettes per day. Which would be the most appropriate recommendation?
Which of the following conditions is thought to be associated with infertility and recurrent pregnancy loss?

A 32-year-old, P2+0, came in OPD with a complaint of irregular menstrual cycles for the last six months. Her ultrasound pelvis shows an endometrial polyp of 3 x 3 cm. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option for this patient?

A 28-year-old Mrs. XYZ, P2+0, married for 11 years, came to the gynaecology outpatient department with a complaint of postcoital bleeding for 6 months. Her pap smear shows moderate cervical dysplasia. What is the next most important step in her management?

A 35-year-old Mrs. Gulzar, P3+0, last born 2 months back, known hypertensive for 5 years, has a history of heavy menstrual bleeding for 18 months. She is also breastfeeding her child. She comes to the gynaecology outpatient department to take advice on the use of some sort of long-acting contraceptive (LARC) method to avoid unintended pregnancy. What is the most effective method of LARC, keeping in view her medical problems?

A 24-year-old young girl came to the outpatient department with a history of prolonged menstrual cycles for 6 months and increasing hair growth on the chin and breast. She also reported a weight gain of 5 kg in the past few months. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old woman presents to the gynecology outpatient department with amenorrhea for 2 months and light vaginal bleeding for 3 days. She also complains of morning sickness. Her vitals are stable, and abdominal examination reveals a single alive fetus of 9 weeks with positive cardiac activity on ultrasound. What is the most probable management option?

A 39-year-old Mrs. XYZ, nulliparous, attended the gynecology OPD with complaints of cessation of periods for 14 months. She carries a report showing FSH level of 45 IU/ml. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 16-year-old boy suffers from 5α-reductase enzyme deficiency. He was raised as a girl but at puberty, male secondary sex characteristics appeared, and male genital growth occurred. The level of which of the following hormones was reduced as a result of this deficiency until puberty?
A 20-year-old female was diagnosed with a hydatidiform mole. Which histologic feature would differentiate a partial hydatidiform mole from a complete hydatidiform mole?

A 25-year-old, para 3+0, came to the gynecology clinic with a diagnosis of premenstrual syndrome. She does not want to use any medicine for her treatment. Which of the following alternate therapies has good results for treating premenstrual syndrome?

A 22-year-old unmarried girl presents to the gynecology clinic. Her menstrual cycles are regular, and she is complaining of mood swings, irritability, anxiety, bloating, and breast tenderness before her periods. She has brought a symptom diary of two months suggesting a diagnosis of premenstrual syndrome. Which of the following is the first-line therapy for this condition?

A 16-year-old unmarried girl presents to the gynecology outpatient department as she has not started her menstruation yet. Her secondary sexual characteristics are well-developed according to her age. Her body mass index is normal. She has had cyclical lower abdominal pain for one and a half years. On examination, a mass of about 16 weeks is palpable in the lower abdomen, and on inspection, a tense bluish bulge at the hymen is seen. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis for this patient?

A 28-year-old nulliparous woman came to the outpatient department with a complaint of inability to conceive for 4 years. She has regular menstrual cycles and a history of dysmenorrhea, which has increased over the past year. She also reports off-and-on vaginal discharge and lower abdominal pain. What could be the likely cause of her subfertility?

48-year-old Mrs. ABC, para 5+0, menopausal for 18 months, comes to the gynaecology outpatient department with complaints of hot flashes, mood swings, bone pains, and loss of libido. She is a known case of diabetes and inherited thrombophilia, and suffers from migraine. What is the absolute contraindication for the use of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) in this woman?

A 31-year-old female, para 3+1 comes to the emergency department with a history of three months of amenorrhea followed by heavy vaginal bleeding and lower abdominal pain for 1 day. On examination, the pulse is 90 beats per minute, BP is 100/60 mmHg, and the abdomen is soft. On vaginal examination, she is passing blood clots and the cervical os is open. On ultrasound, the uterus is 12 weeks in size. The given presentation best corresponds to which one of the following?

A 48-year-old lady, para 4, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of feeling a mass on the vulva. She also complains of on-and-off bleeding for the last 6 months. On examination, an ulcerated mass is found on the vulval area, which bleeds on touch. Which method is appropriate to diagnose the disease?

A 32 years old Mrs. XYZ, visits the antenatal clinic at 10 weeks of pregnancy for booking. She has 4 children, all delivered vaginally. The last child was 4 kg and was admitted to the nursery. She complains of excessive thirst. You request a random glucose test, which comes out to be 220 mg/dl. Which one of the following is the best management of this patient?

answers.option: Home blood sugar monitoring, and glucophage
Admit, blood sugar charting, diet, exercise, and insulin
Admit, blood sugar charting, and glucophage

question: A mother is worried about the early development of breast and pubic hair in her daughter. What is the most likely age of precocious puberty?

answers.option: Onset of secondary sexual characters before age 12 in girls
Onset of secondary sexual characters before age 8 in girls
Onset of secondary sexual characters before age 6 in girls
Onset of secondary sexual characters before age 10 in girls

question: A 6-year-old girl presented to the outpatient department with the development of breasts and the appearance of pubic hair for the last 6 months. On examination, she is tall as compared to her peers. What is the most appropriate blood test you will advise initially?

A 15-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department for the assessment of delayed puberty. She is developmentally normal. On examination, she is at Tanner’s stage 1. What will be the most appropriate management of this patient's condition?

A 32-year-old woman para 2+0, last born six months back, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with a complaint of amenorrhea for three months. She has a history of irregular periods for six months and weight gain for five months. She is breastfeeding her baby. Her BMI is normal. Which investigation will you advise her?
